name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Mississippi’s recovery from Covid is significantly ahead of most of the nation.  Let’s capitalize on our momentum and act BOLD - Eliminating the income tax is the single most important item for future and sustained long term economic growth.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Thousands of COVID vaccine appointments are available right now! Teachers, first responders, anyone over 65, and anyone with a listed pre-existing condition qualifies! Schedule for yourself or a loved one now! Online at  https://t.co/AxGnAgTUeZ or call 877-978-6453.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Today, we will officially have more Mississippians who have received a COVID vaccine than those who have tested positive—a historic milestone and turning point in this fight.   I’m in Hattiesburg to thank our National Guardsmen who have made that possible:  https://t.co/z5D1b19f6I

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: This weekend, we celebrated 100,000 COVID shots in arms, starting on December 14th. Today, we can celebrate 150,000 COVID shots in arms. Things are moving quickly and much more smoothly! We’ll use every vaccine that we get! Mississippi is ready to be DONE with COVID—Amen?

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: We just scheduled 20,000 new first doses of the COVID vaccine in an afternoon! This is why it was so important to open access—people are ready! We’ll get them out as fast as we can get them in. More opportunities coming as soon as we get more supply—working on additional avenues.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: 20,000 new COVID vaccine appointments were loaded today! Go to  https://t.co/AxGnAgTUeZ or call 877-978-6453 to schedule an appointment. God bless!

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Today we opened up the COVID Vaccine to 65+ and those with preexisting conditions. Huge surge in calls and web traffic are causing delays for users, but please keep at it! Working our end as well. Bottleneck is not ideal, but the alternative (restricting access) is worse!

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: You can make appointments by going to  https://t.co/slktoJhMv6 or by calling the COVID call center at 1-877-978-6453. These plans were just finalized, so give workers a bit of time to make them actionable. I wanted to get the information out right away! God bless!

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Severe weather is very possible tonight and we know these late December storms can be very unpredictable!!  Keep your alerts on, understand the potential risk, and stay home if you can!!  COVID is one reason - severe weather is another. Be aware, Stay safe and God bless.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: The first COVID vaccine has been administered in MS! It’s a historic American accomplishment. If all goes perfectly (which is rare in 2020 but let’s pray) we may be able to distribute about as many vaccines in Mississippi over the next month as we have total COVID cases now.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: COVID-19 continues to rage throughout the country and here in Mississippi. Please be extra cautious and mindful during this time. We will have an update on our EO later this week—in the meantime the best tool is the same: wear a mask. Avoid crowds. Be smart. Protect loved ones.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: I have a call with HHS officials today at 2:00 to discuss the progress on vaccines and our distribution plan and strategy. So, I’ll see you at 2:30 tomorrow with an update on our fight against Covid! Stay safe. Please wear a mask. Small groups. Social distancing.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Planning to do a Facebook Live at 2:30...focus will be on COVID-19 (across the state and in my own family.) As cases rise, please take the threat seriously. None of us want to be responsible for spreading this disease to our most vulnerable loved ones.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: I want to share a prayer request. My youngest daughter just tested positive for COVID-19. She feels OK, but could still use prayers! Please pray for her momma too!  Our entire family will be getting tested again and isolating for the time being. Stay safe, and God bless!

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: 17% decrease in Mississippi COVID cases this week compared to last week. Even as cases surge in most states.  Keep up the good work! We can do this without going crazy on government interventions—people get it! Virtue signaling is useless, but limited action in key areas works!

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Very proud of the frontlines team that has worked hard to attack the COVID-19 virus in Mississippi. Incredible logistical effort to bring targeted resources to the fight, while standing firm that schools and businesses must stay open! Save lives—don’t destroy them in the process!  https://t.co/Q7SsGB5Jk0

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Important to remember that COVID-19 is not gone! We’ve seen numbers increase over the past few weeks. Please stay watchful and protect yourself. We want to be cautious and limited in using executive action—we’re counting on the people of Mississippi to be wise and careful!

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: This graph tells the story of what you’ve accomplished. It hasn’t been easy or pleasant, but you’ve gotten us out of a terrible COVID-19 situation. It’s only because the people stepped up. We did it without closing any business and while opening schools. Thank you and God bless.  https://t.co/Jt2oHQEAae

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Car wreck caused a power outage at our press conference location this morning. Prayers for all involved. Going to hop on Facebook Live at 2:30 to give an update on COVID-19 in Mississippi. Most counties are improving, but some need to be extra aware. Back to briefings tomorrow.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: College football is essential. What do opponents of football think, these kids will end up in a bubble without it? You can get COVID anywhere.  There are forces who want to cancel everything to avoid risk at all societal costs. It’s foolish. We have to balance risk & costs.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: One of those projects was $2 million from the CARES Act relief fund for a business deal with a hospital that’s been closed for years. Closed for years! Nothing to do with COVID! I wonder who’s involved behind the scenes... The other was for community organizing to fix disparity.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: For all COVID-19 related executive orders and further information to help you through these difficult times, go to our website at  https://t.co/LIwMSjuJbw.  https://t.co/8Rs8726LOj

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: You may think that getting COVID-19 is no big deal unless you’re elderly. It’s not just about you being tougher than COVID. Right now, there are two ICU beds available in the entire area surrounding Jackson. It’s a bad day for a car wreck in central MS. That affects us all.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: I see a lot of people pointing to the high survival rate with COVID-19. That’s an important data point to consider. But the risk has always been to our health care system. As beds fill up, no patient gets the care they need—Coronavirus, heart attack... Overwhelmed is overwhelmed.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: There are some people who seem determined not to believe any COVID-19 data—“It’s all fake.” I think that group is actually pretty small. Most people are reading, examining, and trying to stay informed. There’s lots out there. For transparency, here’s the numbers we’re looking at:

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: COVID-19 is extremely dangerous. School closures are dangerous. Mass unemployment is dangerous. Those aren’t contradictory ideas. We have to mitigate the damage from all of them. Pretending this is simple, when it’s so obviously not, makes intelligent people stop listening.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Skepticism is good. We should all question authority constantly. I questioned the risk/reward of long-term lockdowns, and went against the grain many times. It’s not wrong to do so. But I’m telling you, the effects of COVID-19 on hospitals are not hypothetical. It’s happening.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: COVID-19 is spreading and killing in our state. It is not a hypothetical, it is happening. Today, I’ve extended our executive orders to mitigate the threat—adding 10 counties to the list of those with stricter measures in place. We’ll discuss more at our 2:30 briefing today.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: The experts say we need 70-80% of the population to get COVID-19 to achieve herd immunity. Let’s assume they’re wrong (it’s certainly possible, they have been before.) Let’s assume they’re being way overly cautious and we actually only need 40% infection for herd immunity.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: My girls and I tested negative for COVID-19. Limited contact with the people who were diagnosed, but better safe than sorry! If someone you know gets the virus, get a test! Back with a 2:30 briefing tomorrow.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: I will say, as I’ve said before, local news largely does a good job. Like I said in my Facebook Live—my tweet and point were about national media celebrating mass protests, pretending there were zero COVID-19 concerns. ALL mass gatherings are risky—even if you love their politics

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: I’m waiting on the results of a COVID-19 test. It appears numerous members of the Mississippi House are confirmed to have contracted the virus last week—only one of whom I was briefly in contact with.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: 1,092 new COVID-19 cases today. They’re mostly in young people who may not get deathly ill—but could easily debilitate loved ones.  I don’t know how to be more clear: Coronavirus is not gone just because you give up. It can still overwhelm us.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: We’re closely tracking COVID numbers—they are rising. I know that everyone wants this to be behind us. It’s not. Please, please don’t give up the fight. Imagine the pain if someone you love has serious consequences from a disease you spread. That risk is real and present.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Today we saw 489 new COVID-19 cases—a large number by any measure. I’m concerned that people are losing interest in the effort to keep each other safe. We are all tired and ready to be done, but the virus doesn’t care. Please be on your guard—small efforts have a big impact!

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Big news tomorrow—but need until tomorrow to finalize it. We’ll do a briefing then to discuss it and another one on Friday. Stay safe and God bless! Don’t let your guard down on COVID-19.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: I want you to be able to express your pain and anger in a way that is as safe as possible. I heard about the protest in Jackson tomorrow, and asked MEMA to get COVID-19 masks together for anybody who needs one. Highway Patrol will get them to protestors. Stay safe and God bless!

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Can we take a moment to appreciate the unprecedented White House support for states battling COVID? The President extended Title 32 orders for our National Guard—massive. We could not have done rapid testing of all nursing homes without it! Thank you @realDonaldTrump and @VP!

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Jim Hood said his DC law firm is going to sue Mississippi small businesses—blaming them for the spread of COVID-19—even if you follow the rules. All must be protected from liberal lawyers if acting in good faith. Ambulance chasers. I’d call a special session if legislature asks!

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Today’s press conference will include some big news that has little to do with COVID-19. Even in the face of this historic pandemic, we’ve got a lot of other important work to do. Protecting Mississippians is a big job with lots of elements. Excited to share with you at 2:30 PM!

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: COVID-19 is real, contagious, and deadly. We cannot avoid taking it seriously. We should also not avoid sharing data that produces hope—and there is cause for hope. We’ve found 9,908 MS cases with 457 deaths. We’ve also found 6,268 recoveries. We will survive and emerge stronger.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: We cannot continue to take a sledgehammer to COVID-19 in this country. We have to be surgical. The human cost of every protective measure is real, and so is the deadly risk of the disease. Today, I signed an order to put stricter measures on 7 counties in Mississippi.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: 35,843 more Mississippians lost their jobs this week. Thousands more have been infected with COVID-19. The state has CARES Act emergency funds in our bank account right now to pay for relief. It may be delayed for weeks or months for a political debate—I hope and pray not.  https://t.co/sVdyrCc9gS

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: It means people are exercising their freedom of speech. It's what I signed up for when I threw my hat in the ring, and it's what every public figure should expect. If you have a problem with the COVID-19 response, I'm the one you should be mad at. I'm ultimately responsible.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: MS Gov meets MSNBC! I’ll be on with Chuck Todd at 4:00 PM to talk about Mississippi’s efforts to combat COVID-19 and safely reopen our economy. Should be an interesting conversation!

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: “Mississippi ranks No. 6 among all states in testing for the new coronavirus...The five states doing more testing than Mississippi, as of April 15, all have dealt with more serious outbreaks of COVID-19, case records show.”  https://t.co/tf4DZPfqqh

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: We are back to the usual 2:30 briefing schedule this week. I look forward to speaking with you this afternoon. We will discuss yesterday’s deadly storms, the state’s COVID-19 response, and our economic crisis hitting working families.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: I pray every day for an end to this COVID-19 crisis. And we are all acting together to protect our people. We have been through other trials and overcome. We will come through this too.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: I will be attending a meeting with President Trump and the COVID-19 Task Force tomorrow during the time we would typically have a press briefing. We will have one on Friday at 9:00 AM, where I will announce our decision on the shelter-in-place order that is set to expire Monday.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: I want to highlight some stories of Mississippi small businesses stepping up to help their communities face COVID-19. They deserve a big thank you! If you’ve seen any go above and beyond to lend a hand to support fellow Mississippians, comment below with their name and the story!

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Violent storms are headed for our state on Easter Sunday—including dangerous hail and tornados—just as we enter our COVID-19 peak. Our state needs prayer. Emergency responders and health care workers are stretched thin, but operating with courage. Stay safe and God bless.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Looking forward to our statewide town hall on COVID-19. Tune in at 7:00–check local listings.  https://t.co/fDj6Trlkx5

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: The national models project that America might have 100,000 to 250,000 deaths from COVID-19 if everyone social distances. Mississippi represents about 1% of the US population. That means, if it hit everyone equally, Mississippi would expect 1,000 to 2,500 deaths.   Thread:

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: There’s a lot of bigger issues out there right now: lives are on the line based on what we all do to slow the spread of COVID-19. This may seem like a small thing given the serious nature of the times, but we’ve gotten a massive amount of questions and calls on this one issue:

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: We will be making a major announcement regarding a new phase in Mississippi’s efforts to combat COVID-19 at 3:30. It will require all of us to adapt in order to save lives. Check your local news or follow on our Facebook page where we will live stream. God bless and stay safe.  https://t.co/jRu9wflQ9f

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: I have signed a Memorandum of Understanding with the federal government to provide relief for Mississippians who lose the ability to work because of COVID-19. It’s made possible by the relief bill that the President signed. Here’s what it does:  https://t.co/dlwLFY6tsm

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Our top health expert, Dr. Thomas Dobbs, is going to join me on Facebook Live this afternoon at 3:00 for an update on the status of COVID-19 in Mississippi and our strategy to protect our people. Please plan to join us and spread the word if you can—valuable information for all.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Watch the full press conference where our top health official Dr. Dobbs outlines our new aggressive COVID-19 approach. We now have the resources to begin implementing it. Here’s what it boils down to:   https://t.co/tLcbeXLvRU

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Press conference at 1:30 to discuss our state’s response to COVID-19. Dr. Dobbs will outline the new approach that we will shortly be able to implement: dramatic increase in testing and localized, targeted action based on that data. Stay safe, and tune in at 1:30 if you can.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Proud to share critical COVID-19 information with Mississippi’s senior citizens today—in a safe way—via the @AARP.  https://t.co/SpfOMyP4mh

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Candid, productive discussion with @VP and other governors going on now to coordinate our response to COVID-19. We’re following our experts every step of the way. We will do everything in our power to protect public health by making decisions that will not do more harm than good.  https://t.co/K96h2QCMJ6

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Tomorrow at 3:00 PM, I’ll be going live on Facebook to answer questions from the people of Mississippi about our ongoing response to COVID-19. Please comment below with your questions and join me tomorrow as we discuss our path forward as a state. I will answer as many as I can.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: I just signed an executive order to provide unemployment benefits to help Mississippi workers and their families during this COVID-19 outbreak. Here's how it accomplishes that:  1/5  https://t.co/88BNl94J5N

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: I'll be going live on Facebook at 12:00 PM today to talk about our ongoing efforts to slow the spread of COVID-19 in Mississippi. Small business loans, elections, unemployment benefits, and more. Please join me if you can!

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Dr. Dobbs and his dedicated team are working around the clock to keep Mississippians safe and healthy. I‘m grateful for all they are doing to get out accurate information about COVID-19. If you have any questions, please call the Mississippi Coronavirus Hotline ➡️ 877-978-6453

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Tomorrow at noon, I‘ll be going live on Facebook to talk about our ongoing response to COVID-19. I‘ll discuss our SBA small business loan approval, delaying the 2nd Congressional District GOP primary runoff, efforts to secure unemployment benefits to help MS workers, & much more.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: In times of crisis, we must use every resource available to protect the health and well-being of all Mississippians. Increasing telehealth ensures we continue to provide care while working to slow the spread of COVID-19.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: COVID-19 has created a lot of uncertainty as many are sent home. Allowing our counties, cities, and schools to pay their employees will help them weather this storm. Honored to sign HB 1647 today to ensure our workers at the local level are taken care of during this outbreak.  https://t.co/5q03e4ZYf3

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Spoke with President @realDonaldTrump, @VP Mike Pence, and governors around the nation to discuss our coordinated COVID-19 responses.   We will continue working closely and coordinating with leaders across the country to #SlowtheSpread. We are all in this fight together.  https://t.co/IhtYZDmJ9V

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: As COVID-19 began claiming lives across the world, we knew this would eventually hit Mississippi. But that doesn’t make it any easier for Mississippi to lose one of our own. Elee and I are praying for all his loved ones and their community as we all deal with this tragic loss.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: I’ll be going live on Facebook at 10:00 AM to talk about our plans for schools in response to the COVID-19 outbreak.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Meeting with Governors from across the country, via the @NatlGovsAssoc, to discuss our COVID-19 responses and share knowledge. Working together is essential at this uncertain time.  https://t.co/IgLvmlzCbI

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: We’re going live on Facebook at 3:00 to answer questions from the people of Mississippi about COVID-19. Schools, tests, our economy, and more. Please join us if you can!

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Tomorrow at 3:00 PM, I will do a Facebook Live answering your questions about the COVID-19 outbreak and our state’s response. Comment your questions on the linked post or by replying here and we will answer as many as we can.  https://t.co/ALaqL9oY6T

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Mississippi casinos will be closed until further notice at midnight tonight as we all work to prevent the spread of Covid-19.

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: I just signed two executive orders responding to the Covid-19 outbreak. Here’s what they do:  https://t.co/oRqGQdkG1y

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: The overwhelming number of people who called into our press conference crashed the teleconference service. We are going live on our Facebook page at 3:30 PM to update the people of Mississippi on our response to the Covid-19 outbreak and share important information. Tune in!

name: Tate Reeves
tweet: Morning meeting with COVID-19 team to talk mobile testing, limits on gatherings, and support for families affected by the response.  We will have updates as plans are finalized and facts are confirmed. Please be safe today. We’re in this together—protect your neighbors.  https://t.co/Fp9kGgnVvb
